track.name: Summertime
comments: Summertime and the livin's easy. Fish are jumpin' & the cotton is high. ♥

@sarrassin: If you're hearing the same classic 1939' version of Summertime, then the Sidney Bechet Quintet is Meade Lux Lewis (piano), Teddy Bunn (guitar), Johnny Williams (double bass), Sidney Catlett (drums) and Sidney Bechet (soprano sax); recorded June 8, 1939 in New York.
...and now you know why it's called the "licorice stick".
Blue and warm like the summer. A song for all seasons.
LOVE THAT NEW ORLEANS CLARINET STYLE.
The signature clarinet style of New Orleans jazz; it informed the playing off all the clarinetists to ever follow him in New Orleans style.
Reminds me of the Thin Man films.
What a treasure this man is.
wail on!  You gotta love clarinet after hearing this!
